snippet: Much of what plagues New Jersey economically can be explained by the fate of the bridge, which is on life support. But how to finance repairs is a grave problem, because the state is a transportation pauper.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column says that much of what plagues New Jersey economically can be explained by fate of Pulaski Skyway, which is on life support; notes that financing repairs is serious issue because state's transportation fund borders on insolvency, with most of its money going to pay off old bonds.
lead_paragraph: Much of what plagues New Jersey economically can be explained by the fate of the bridge, which is on life support. But how to finance repairs is a grave problem, because the state is a transportation pauper.

headline.main: Ailing Pulaski Skyway Offers a Lesson in Creative Financing
headline.print_headline: An Ailing Bridge Offers a Lesson in Creative Financing
